ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.2_0: At that time a government official who was going away sent a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.3_0: “Come, Venerables, I wish to give a robe to those who have completed the rainy-season residence.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.5_0: “The Buddha has completed the rainy-season residence according to resident monks.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.6_0: and being afraid of wrongdoing they did not go.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.7_0: That government official complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.8_0: “How can you not come when I send a message?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.9_0: I’m going out with the army.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.10_0: for the life of purity is hard to give up.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.11_0: The monks heard the complaints of the official,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.13_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.14_0: “I allow you to store haste-cloth and then store it on.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.1_0: Knowing that the Buddha had made this allowance,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.2_0: Knowing that the Buddha had given the allowance to store it, he took it away.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.3_0: monks received haste-cloth and stored them beyond the robe season,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.4_0: in bundles on a bamboo robe-rack.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.5_0: While walking about the dwellings, Venerable Ānanda saw that cloth, and he asked the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.8_0: “How long have you kept this cloth?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.10_0: Venerable Ānanda complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.11_0: “How can these monks receive haste-cloth and then store it beyond the robe season?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.12_0: After rebuking those monks in many ways, Venerable Ānanda told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.13_0: “Is it true, monks, that some monks did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.16_0: “... Monks, how can those foolish men receive haste-cloth and then store it beyond the robe season?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.17_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.18_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.19.1_0: ‘When there are ten days left to the Kattika full moon that ends the first rainy-season residence and haste-cloth is given to a monk, he may receive it if he regards it as urgent. He may then store it until the end of the robe season.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.20_0: If he stores it beyond that, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.2_0: the invitation procedure is ten days in the future.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.3_0: the Kattika full moon of the months...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.4_0: the Kattika full moon of the invitation procedure is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.6_0: if, a monk wants to go to the army, a sick monk wants to pregnant or he has been invited to a rainy-season robe, or he has been brought to the monks, saying, “May I enter the rainy-season residence near,” “I will give a robe”—this is called “give message”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.7_0: He may receive it if he regards it as urgent. He may then store it until the end of the robe season:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.8_0: establishing the perception of it as a haste-cloth, he may store it.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.10_0: if he has not participated in the robe-making procedure, he may eat a meal before another during the last month of the rainy season.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.11_0: for one who has participated in the robe-making procedure, it is the five month period.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.12_0: If he accepts it beyond that limit:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.13_0: for one who has not participated in the robe-making procedure, if he goes beyond the last day of the rainy season, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.14_0: For one who has participated in the robe-making procedure, if he goes beyond the day on which the robe-making season ends, the cloth becomes subject to relinquishment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.15_0: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.16_0: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.18_0: ‘Venerables, this haste-cloth which I have kept beyond the robe season is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.19_0: I relinquish them to the Sangha.’ ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.22_0: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.23.1_0: If it is haste-cloth and he perceives it as such, and he keeps it beyond the robe season, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.24_0: If it is haste-cloth, but he is unsure of it, and he keeps it beyond the robe season, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.25_0: If it is haste-cloth, but he does not perceives it as such, and he keeps it beyond the robe season, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.26_0: If it has not been determined, but he perceives that it has ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.27_0: If it has not been transferred, but he perceives that it has ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.28_0: If it has not been given away, but he perceives that it has ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.29_0: If it has not been lost, but he perceives that it has ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.30_0: If the robe is not destroyed, but he perceives that it is, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.31_0: If it has not been burnt, but he perceives that it has ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.32_0: If it has not been stolen, but he perceives that it has, and he keeps it beyond the robe season, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.33_0: If he uses robe-cloth that should be relinquished without first relinquishing it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.34_0: If it is not haste-cloth, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.35_0: If it is not haste-cloth, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.36_0: If it is not haste-cloth and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.37.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.38_0: if within the robe season the haste-cloth is determined, transferred to another, given away, lost, destroyed, burnt, stolen, or taken on trust;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.40_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.41_0: The eighth rule, the training rule on haste-cloth, is finished.
